form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE REPORT OF INVESTIGATION, FORM G-166 ( (REV. 7-1-84)

full_text: Screened by. NARA, 9/18/2023 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE REPORT OF INVESTIGATION TITLE FILE NUMBER WONG, Wing Hong aka WONG, Charles A17 210 251 REPORT MADE AT DATE BY Los 11/4/68 Loyd Le Netherlin INVESTIGATOR SYNOPSIS DETAILS: SUBJECT'S file shows his admission to the United States at San Pedro, California on 9/13/34 as WONG WING HONG United States citizen son of WONGSICK HONG. File contains application for certificate of citizenship submitted by SUBJECT dated 9/21/67 and menorandum from the citizenship branch dated 7/9/68 stating port files could not be located and asking for investigation. SUBJECT interviewed after request for investigation received. He stated he was not sure about the composition of his family but believed he and a sister who came with him to the U. S. were the only blood children of WONG SICK HONG who had entered the United States. That he had no recollection of ever having seen any of his immigration brothers in China and had not had much to do with any of them after entry. That he did know one of them was operating a laundry on 8th street near Union Avenue in Los Angeles. He was informed he should try to get information from his mother as to the family composition and as to the birthplace of his father. On 9/11/68 Ben Nung WONG aka WONG KWOCK HAI made a sworn affidavit in Los Angeles, copy in file, in which he testified he is a native and citizen of China and an immigration son of WONG SICK HONG who was a clansman from a village about 2 miles from his village in China. He qualified this statement by adding he did not know where WONG SICK HONG 100 was born. He testified he had been told his immigration father did have a blood son who was the youngest son reported. This would be the SUBJECT. He identified immigration son WONG KWOCK ON as his blood brother. On 10/22/68 SUBJECT made an affidavit in which he testified he was born on 8/4/22 at Shiu Chew Vil., TSD., China and that he is a citizen of China. That until recently he had believed he was a citizen through his father but that he had obtained information from his mother and other persons that his father was actually born in China and not in the United States. Hre withdrew his application for a certificate of citizenship. He testified he has never been inspected and a dmitted as an alien. SUBJECT presented an honorable discharge of CHARIES WONG showing active service in the U. S. Navy from 6/25/43 to 3/23/46. He testified that he has not done anything restricted to U. S. citizens since receving information he is not a citizen, that he had refrained from voting the primary election for that reason. He testified that he has never been arrested. That he is married to a native born U. S. citizen and has two children who were born in Los Angeles, California. That he lives with his wife and children. FORM G-166 (REV. 7-1-64) FP1-LPC-5-66-30M-2531
